WRITING.TEXT:
Alright...I'm doing it. I've always said I wouldn't, because I just hate running so much, but today I started a 5K training program. I'm going to try and do a 5K in May, at the conclusion of the program.
I started today and I actually had a really good time. Let's do this.

I absolutely respect Aldo as a fighter, and everything, but as someone who got into the sport right before 189 (not due to Conor, just a coincidence), and has only been exposed to him in the last year, I gotta say, he's REALLY turning me off with this shit talking lately.
I get he wants the fight, but this comes across so strangely, at least to me.
Wait, what? What is this? I think I'm $13 curious.
That's a shame. I like her, but she NEEDS a Flyweight division to seriously compete in.
Yeah, as I recall, she was actively fighting for one. I was really happy for her when Dana seemed to be implying that one was on the way, but...
Jesus. What a disgusting fight, from the reffing side.
Um... Ok.
I didn't like the stop so late, but most seem to think it was a well done stoppage, so I'll defer to those who know better than me.

Also: Olympic Games
* 2000 Summer Olympics - Judo, 9th place (U/81 kg) * 2004 Summer Olympics - Judo, 7th place (U/90 kg) * 2008 Summer Olympics - Judo, 21st place (U/90 kg) * 2012 Summer Olympics - Judo, 17th place (U/100 kg)
Screw that ref, wow.
You're welcome.
Joe was getting SO exasperated by this point, too. Really just adds to the whole helplessness of the situation.

So, seriously, long term, what do you want the UFC to be? An entity that makes a ton of money based on entertaining matchups, or an organization that pits the best of weight classes against each other as they attempt to be king of the hill/belt holder?
If Conor wants to abdicate his belt, and continue to fight money fights, then I don't care what he does. But if you think it really is in the best, long-term interest of a sport that is still trying to get over the hump of being truly mainstream to hold up talent for the bottom dollar, I can't agree with you.
There's a fine line, and the UFC needs to be careful with the way they're toeing it, that's all.
Do you want the UFC to be a legit sports competition or a series of exhibitions?
You're right. The NFL should have just held exhibition matches between The Broncos and Patriots while they had the chance and the money was there.
At least the fight would matter.
Fine, you made me laugh. You happy?
I was sitting here way too focused on him, lol, glad someone else noticed too.
Just wanted to let everyone know I finally had success updating. It took every device in my house to do it, but finally my husband's Macbook got the job done.
Walking around Disneyland last week ended up gaining me the lowest calorie burning "bike ride" of all time.
It did this to me right before the firmware update debacle. Did you successfully update?
Finally got the newest firmware upgrade for the Charge HR to install. I think that's an achievement, right?

I mentioned in a comment section a few days back that I was thinking of attempting a size 6 pair of jeans.
I tried them on today.
They didn't fit.
Had to try on the 4s instead _.
They were definitely vanity sized, though, but I'll accept this super awesome small victory. I'm down from almost a size 16 at my heaviest to now comfortably a 6. I can handle that. More importantly, I fit into juniors pants easily again, which means I can buy clothes that actually fit me (short a f over here). This weight loss journey is almost at its end and I can hardly believe it.
And you know how I did it?
Counted calories.
I went to the gym as well, definitely, but I saw the most obvious losses when I stuck to my calorie deficit.
I want to thank you all here for getting me over the hump. I was at a plateau for nearly 7 months. Then I gained weight back over the holidays. Since I started reading this sub about two months ago, I'm back down ten pounds, and one pound away from a healthy weight on the new BMI calculator (I'm already below 25 on the old one). So, again, a HUGE thank you to everyone for the motivation!
EDIT: Oh, I should mention, getting a Fitbit was also a HUGE help. MFP is great, but the Fitbit was more brutally honest with me about how many calories I needed to be consuming, based on my activity for the day. Once I got the Fitbit, things got a lot harder, but the weight loss got a lot easier.
You had to use the wireless sync dongle to connect through the MacBook, though, right?
I wish I had never done.. At least before I did that I could still sync.
My computer is running Windows 10, so I don't think I can do without the dongle

WRITING.TITLE: Lots of problems connecting my Charge HR
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi everyone,
So, I've had my Charge HR for about two months now. About two weeks ago I started to notice some serious lag in connectivity between it and my phone.
A few days ago, a firmware update was released. My Charge HR updated about halfway and then suddenly stopped connecting with my phone at all. I made several attempts to restart the update to no avail.
I uninstalled the app, reinstalled it, restarted my phone, restarted the fitbit, etc. Finally I deleted the device from the app and factory reset the fitbit. The app says, "We've Found your Charge HR" but then it says to either Try Again, or restart my bluetooth, none of which fixes anything.
So what's the deal? It can see the Charge HR, but it won't sync?
Also, two days ago, when things started going haywire, the fitbit started logging HUGE numbers of calories burned and steps taken, then the clock got off by about 5 minutes.
I don't know what else to do, I can't find my wireless sync dongle, but I'm pretty frustrated and will try just about anything. I'm hoping there's another option besides buying a new dongle.
Over the last 6 months or so, he's begun slowly shifting into a neck and neck race with Arlvoski as my favorite fighter. I'm glad I wasn't around for the "hate" period in his career.
Anyone. I just badly want to see him fight again :(
Thank you. I was waiting for someone to come in here and point out that this is a traditional dish.
You absolutely do. I've also enjoyed the experiences of said sushi. You don't have to drown something in a sauce to achieve a correct flavor profile.
Either way, the Daisy Ridley thing was pretty unacceptable, to me. I'm getting so beyond tired of seeing this term "real woman".

Oh come on. What do people want out of life? Commercials/movies/tv/magazine photos/etc are going to need about 1000 people in them, per, if we're going to need to make sure that ALL types of people aren't feeling marginalized...

I've not been on this sub long, but long enough that I was wondering why there wasn't more Michelle Obama hate in these posts.
Quota = Full
HAES is a registered trademark? TIL...
Yeah, exactly. I'm 5'1.5" and 133 lbs. I'm *thinking* of trying out a size 6 soon, but fit comfortably in an 8. There's zero chance.

This is a joke, right?
I remember when I used to do this. I was nearly 200 pounds, same height as her, and I'd always say things like, 'you wouldn't think it to look at me, would you?' I knew I was fat, but I was trying to logic myself out of JUST how fat I was.
Now eat your shoe, Brian Stann.

Her writing about, as u/52in52hedgehog put it, (insert spoiler here) really resonated with my husband. I think it might be his favorite thing he's ever read. It helped him out a lot because he was able to, through someone else, put feelings into words, and that's been a huge help for him in his life.
https://www.reddit.com/r/fatlogic/comments/49svq2/normal_weight_star_wars_actress_being_called_too/d0un9s6
I hope this is the straw that broke the camel's back on this skinny shaming bullshit.

Thank you, thank you. I really put a lot of effort into it and it's good to know that it's been appreciated ;).
But no, seriously, it just kinda crept up on me for about 20 or 30 pages or so, this feeling where it was like, 'something's wrong here.' And then I finally realized, the problem was I'd started seriously disliking the book. Rolling my eyes at dialogue, sighing over plot points, being generally disappointed by stereotypical behaviors or actions. Parts of the book going almost nowhere, etc.
Plus, it was pitched as a comedy, and honestly, it got a lot darker than I was mentally prepared for rather quickly. So, I don't know, maybe in a different frame of mind I'd have liked it more, but when you see things like this before ever even reading the plot:
Hugh Laurie concocts an uproarious cocktail of comic zingers and over-the-top action in this "ripping spoof of the spy genre"
you don't exactly go into it expecting a lot of melodrama and introspection, I guess.
*The Gun Seller*. I thought I was enjoying it, but I've realized that I am, in fact, not.

I'm two books behind, but that's what Graphic Novel month is for. I could read all of those books in about a day or two, except maybe Hyperbole and a Half, so I'll be using that month to also catch up on the 1 book I never read (Lolita) and finishing Catch 22, which I was reading in place of Dorian.
I don't know, he had some emotional shit going on this season.
Ireland card, tho. That's all I'm saying. That wasn't a good night for SBG at all.
Thank you!
The EA curse is real. Don't try to ignore it. Embrace it and only put retired fighters / NFL players on the cover.

While I am advocating for an improvement on his bjj in another thread, I do agree, he absolutely gave up his back to avoid being tko'd and face a long lay-off. I believe that.
But I still want to see him improve that ground game.
I hope so. That woman has me hella excited.

Since Conor obviously won't leave (imagine the backlash), they at least need to bring a top tier bjj coach in.
His weakness is obvious, so get on it now while he's still young enough to really improve.
While he's been called that, look at the record of other SBG fighters recently.

I agree. And honestly, I don't see him ever losing at featherweight at this point. For the sake of his health, I only want to see him fight at FW one more time, preferably against Frankie. After that, let Aldo come to lightweight if he wants a rematch. Plus, remember what the move did for AJ.
I think Conor at LW us going to be a ton of fun. He needs to shore up the ground game, sure, but I think you're going to see more interesting *fights* from him there. Wars, instead of one round massacres.
All last night did was re-endear me to Conor, who I'd gone very cold to, and got me SUPER hyped to see what he does next.
I hope this isn't a Rousey. I hope his post fight presence has proved to people that's obviously not who he is. I hope to see him at UFC 200 in a title fight at FW and then the next chapter begin.

I thought Shevchenko fought really strangely last night. Almost like she wanted to prove she had more skill sets, or something. Fight looked completely different than the first, which she took on short notice, and fought defensively to ensure a win, and I respect.
But, yeah, none of that great Clinch work showed up last night and for the life of me, I can't understand why.
Haha! Love it.
Or if you hate Kenny Loggins.
I picked it because I didn't know it was a book first and I try to read them before I see the films, this one especially, having come so highly recommended.

My review of this from Goodreads is brief. I wish I could take all of the things I've had to say about this book in person and really get it down in to good writing, but I just can't.
A beautiful melancholy to this I want expecting. I really feel like the film doesn't do the story justice. Enjoyed it far more than I expected to.

Mainly there was just such a feeling of false bravado throughout the book, that I think the filmmakers truly missed. I never thought I'd read this book. I couldn't be happier that I did.
Good idea, I may have to take you up on that, since I just finished Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas not even 6 months ago.
Give it a chance. I hated the movie a few years back when I saw it because I thought it was lacking in substance. The book had depth the film seemed to gloss over.
Check out the used section on Amazon for the books, sometimes you can pick this stuff up for a few bucks.

Not that I didn't want it, but Deadpool was not on my list of things I wanted to read. Hardly any of the super hero ones were. I love comic books, of that nature, I just wasn't feeling it this time around, especially since I haven't got into the Deadpool mythos yet at all, so I'll be skipping this one in favor of another Deadpool selection. Yeah, the book certainly amused, but as far as like, laugh out loud moments, that only happened once. When the cheese incident occurred.

As a non-smoker I found myself amused by how often I'd be like, "Yeah Nick! Great maneuver." Honestly, I felt pity for most of the people involved in the story, more than anything else. It's true that the country was practically founded on tobacco and an end to the industry is detrimental to a large part of the agricultural country.
But it's also true that smoking is bad for you, and no amount of spin tactics can change that. So I had fun reading it, from a sense of relief that in this day and age, we're moving further and further away from the practice.

Ironically, I think this was the first book of the batch that I only read a physical copy of. I never read eBooks, but for this little challenge, I've had to rely on my libraries digital media, so that's meant lots and lots of phone screen squinting.

You liked the ending? I thought it completely undermined the rest of the book, to be honest.
Being born around the same time as you (87), I did LOVE reading something written from the time of my early memories. I'd honestly forgotten about Old Joe, and really cigarette ads in general. It's crazy to see how much has changed since then, and it felt like being in a fun little time machine reading it. Maybe I should find more stuff from the early 90s to check out.
There are some REALLY awesome sounding novels in there. I love manga and comic books, but seriously, I didn't vote for any of it, for hopes that something more unique will be picked.
Didn't realize this was a book, let alone a graphic novel. I never got a chance to watch the film. Would LOVE to see this picked.
This one sounds REALLY fun.
I would be REALLY interested to read that at some point, since I've only ever read *In Cold Blood*. I still find it hard to imagine that the same man wrote both.

Went home sick from work yesterday and spent the evening finishing this.
I was definitely surprised I enjoyed it. I'd always assumed the book would look down its nose too much, instead of what it was, which was a teardown of both sides of the battle.
While I liked the book a great deal for the majority, the final chapter really almost ruined everything.
Still, solid 7.5/10 gave it a 4 on goodreads, giving it a 7 here.
Aww come now that's not in the spirit of things. I hate comedy books, so getting out of my comfort zone this month is a fun challenge.

Disagree with you, but that's OK. I've seen interviews with Cormier where he seems to suggest that he's just hyping the fight, where I feel like I've more than once seen Jones say he just straight up hates the guy, outside of them being in a fight camp against one another.

It's still my absolute favorite rivalry.
Even if it's kinda artificial on Cormier's side, I don't know how one can deny Jones' hate is real.
Appreciate it. I had actually heard all of that months ago but forgot in the ensuing sea of meme.
Had a feeling. That fight was basically a sudden death match for both of them. Shame, it was really great and I was hoping maybe he'd proved enough to stay.

This was my first live Silva fight. I loved it. I haven't seen the fight against Diaz. With all the bitching about it, I assumed it was a boring fight. Was it actually more similar to this fight? No problem.

I voted for Tangles as well. Alzheimer's is a topic that brings me to tears almost immediately. I really don't handle the topic well, but I care about it so much. I'd love to see how it's presented in such a way.
I admit that I am not a fan of non-fiction when I read. I couldn't tell you why. I was a history major in college and I love documentaries. I don't know what it is about the act of reading for pleasure that turns me off of non-fiction, but I like this book club for challenging me to read things I wouldn't. Even the comedy books deal with topics I'd never read about normally, so this is a great experience for me, and I hope others will follow suit in their voting to try and expand horizons a bit.
I'll check out the other selections you mentioned, and I will look into Joe Sacco as well, even if it's not for this particular book challenge. I'm very curious to see how that's presented. I don't know why I don't read more graphic novels, they can be so interesting. Such a new way to look at topics.
